content:
If you recognize that you're being negative and want to work on changing your own behavior, here are some steps you can take:

1. Self-reflect: Take some time to reflect on what's causing you to feel negative. Are there external factors, or is it something within yourself that needs to be addressed?

2. Practice gratitude: Make a conscious effort to focus on the positive things in your life and practice gratitude. This can help shift your mindset towards a more positive outlook.

3. Positive self-talk: Be mindful of the language you use when you talk to yourself. Use positive affirmations to build self-esteem and boost your mood.

4. Mindfulness: Practice mindfulness, which can help you be more aware of your thoughts and emotions. This can help you better manage negative feelings and respond to situations in a more positive way.

5. Seek support: Consider speaking with a therapist or counselor who can provide guidance and support as you work on changing your behavior. You can also talk to trusted friends or family members.

Remember, changing your behavior takes time and effort, but it's worth it in the end. Keep a positive attitude, stay committed to your goals, and celebrate your progress along the way.
